adverb.description: In a way that shows a deliberate and obstinate desire to behave in an unreasonable or unacceptable manner.
examples: the group perversely refused to tour until well past their peak
the minister had acted perversely in failing to publish the report

adverb.description: In a manner contrary to what is expected or accepted.
examples: he was perversely proud of his parochial background
perhaps perversely, it was his niceness that turned some people against him
